001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.util.HashMap;
004import java.util.Map;
005import java.util.Objects;
006import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
007
008import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
009
010import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues.MutableKeyValues;
011
012/**
013 * Key Value Pairs similar to a {@code Map<String,String>} but optimized for memory and
014 * less garbage (no iterators).
015 * <p>
016 * <strong>The integer index used in the low level access are not in array order and thus
017 * {@link #start()} and {@link #next(int)} should be used to iterate over the key values
018 * instead of manually incrementing.</strong>
019 * <p>
020 * The observed order of the current default Key Value Pairs is insertion based ordering
021 * but that should not be relied on as other implementations may change that.
022 * <p>
023 * The preferred way to get all or most of the key values out for formatting is to use
024 * {@link KeyValuesConsumer}.
025 *
026 * @apiNote The current key values implementation is a simple single String array as the
027 * assumption is that most MDC (and or addKeyValuePair) usage is for a couple values and
028 * that many formatting usages particularly JSON or headers are to retrieve
029 * <strong>all</strong> of the key values. Another assumption for the simplicity is to
030 * save memory as there is a potential for many KeyValues with the advent of virtual
031 * threads and key values cannot be escaped analysis or garbage collected quickly because
032 * they are passed all the way down to the output.
033 * <p>
034 * The unfortunate consequence of this is that ad-hoc single key lookup or removal is
035 * <code>O(n)</code> and not <code>O(1)</code>. If you find this unacceptable with
036 * benchmarking because of having many keys and only retrieving a few please file an issue
037 * and we may offer alternative map or binary tree implementations in the future.
038 */
039public sealed interface KeyValues {
040
041        /**
042         * Analogous to {@link Map#get(Object)}
043         * @param key key never <code>null</code>.
044         * @return value for key maybe <code>null</code>.
045         */
046        public @Nullable String getValueOrNull(String key);
047
048        /**
049         * Low-level key access.
050         * @param i index from {@link #start()} or {@link #next(int)}.
051         * @return key.
052         * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is not valid for this key values.
053         */
054        public String key(int i) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException;
055
056        /**
057         * Low-level key access.
058         * @param i index from {@link #start()} or {@link #next(int)}.
059         * @return key.
060         * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is not valid for this key values.
061         */
062        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(int i) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException;
063
064        /**
065         * Returns the index of the first key.
066         * @return the start index which may or may not be zero.
067         */
068        public int start();
069
070        /**
071         * Gets the next key index from the passed in previous key index.
072         * @param i the previous key index.
073         * @return next key index.
074         */
075        public int next(int i);
076
077        /**
078         * Used to easily iterate over the key value pairs without using an iterator.
079         * @param action consumer called on each key value pair.
080         */
081        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
082        void forEach(BiConsumer<? super String, ? super @Nullable String> action);
083
084        /**
085         * Used to easily iterate over the key value pairs without using an iterator.
086         * @param <V> storage type
087         * @param action consumer.
088         * @param counter a pass through integer that can be used for counting purposes or
089         * determining the start perhaps by passing <code>0</code> and then incrementing on
090         * return.
091         * @param storage an extra parameter to avoid unnecessary lambda creation.
092         * @return new value for next counter to be passed to {@link KeyValuesConsumer}.
093         * {@link KeyValuesConsumer#accept(KeyValues, String, String, int, Object)} return.
094         */
095        <V> int forEach(KeyValues.KeyValuesConsumer<V> action, int counter, V storage);
096
097        /**
098         * An immutable empty {@link KeyValues}.
099         * @return immutable empty {@link KeyValues}.
100         */
101        static KeyValues of() {
102                return EmptyKeyValues.INSTANCE;
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * Analogous to {@link Map#size()}.
107         * @return size.
108         */
109        int size();
110
111        /**
112         * Analogous to {@link Map#isEmpty()}.
113         * @return true if empty.
114         */
115        default boolean isEmpty() {
116                return size() <= 0;
117        }
118
119        /**
120         * A special consumer that avoids lambda garbage.
121         *
122         * @param <V> storage
123         */
124        interface KeyValuesConsumer<V> {
125
126                /**
127                 * Accepts the KeyValues at the current key and value.
128                 * @param kvs kvs.
129                 * @param k key.
130                 * @param v value.
131                 * @param index counter.
132                 * @param storage storage like a StringBuidler.
133                 * @return custom user count that will be accumulated. If one was returned for
134                 * each call then the result would be the total count.
135                 */
136                public int accept(KeyValues kvs, String k, @Nullable String v, int index, V storage);
137
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * Creates an immutable key values by copying a Map.
142         * @param m map.
143         * @return immutable key values.
144         * @apiNote Be careful when use {@link Map#of()} as its order is non deterministic and
145         * thus the resulting key values may not be in the order you expect.
146         */
147        public static KeyValues of(Map<String, String> m) {
148                ArrayKeyValues mdc = new ArrayKeyValues(m.size());
149                mdc.putAll(m);
150                return mdc;
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Copies the KeyValues to a Map. This should be used sparingly.
155         * @return map of kvs.
156         */
157        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
158        Map<String, @Nullable String> copyToMap();
159
160        /**
161         * Makes the KeyValues thread safe either by copying or returning if already
162         * immutable.
163         * @return immutable key values.
164         */
165        public KeyValues freeze();
166
167        /**
168         * KeyValues that can be updated.
169         */
170        public sealed interface MutableKeyValues extends KeyValues, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> {
171
172                /**
173                 * Copies.
174                 * @return kvs copy.
175                 */
176                MutableKeyValues copy();
177
178                /**
179                 * Same as {@link Map#put(Object, Object)}.
180                 * @param key key.
181                 * @param value value maybe <code>null</code>.
182                 */
183                void putKeyValue(String key, @Nullable String value);
184
185                /**
186                 * Fluent version of put.
187                 * @param key key.
188                 * @param value value maybe <code>null</code>.
189                 * @return this.
190                 */
191                default MutableKeyValues add(String key, @Nullable String value) {
192                        putKeyValue(key, value);
193                        return this;
194                }
195
196                /**
197                 * Same as {@link Map#remove(Object)}.
198                 * @param key key.
199                 */
200                void remove(String key);
201
202                /**
203                 * Same as {@link #putKeyValue(String, String)} but will ignore null keys from
204                 * sources that have null keys.
205                 */
206                @Override
207                default void accept(@Nullable String t, @Nullable String u) {
208                        if (t == null) {
209                                return;
210                        }
211                        putKeyValue(t, u);
212                }
213
214                /**
215                 * Same as {@link Map#putAll(Map)}.
216                 * @param m map.
217                 */
218                default void putAll(Map<String, String> m) {
219                        m.forEach(this);
220                }
221
222                /**
223                 * Copies a map into {@link MutableKeyValues}.
224                 * @param m map.
225                 * @return key values
226                 */
227                public static MutableKeyValues of(Map<String, String> m) {
228                        int size = m.size();
229                        var kvs = of(size == 0 ? 4 : size);
230                        kvs.putAll(m);
231                        return kvs;
232                }
233
234                /**
235                 * Creates mutable keys with pre-allocation.
236                 * @param size should be greater than 0.
237                 * @return mutable keys.
238                 */
239                public static MutableKeyValues of(int size) {
240                        return new ArrayKeyValues(size);
241                }
242
243                /**
244                 * Empty mutable keys with default pre-allocation.
245                 * @return mutable keys.
246                 */
247                public static MutableKeyValues of() {
248                        return new ArrayKeyValues();
249                }
250
251        }
252
253        /**
254         * Pretty prints key values.
255         * @param kvs kvs.
256         * @param sb StringBuilder.
257         */
258        public static void prettyPrint(KeyValues kvs, StringBuilder sb) {
259                sb.append('{');
260                kvs.forEach(AbstractArrayKeyValues.toStringer, 0, sb);
261                sb.append('}');
262        }
263
264        /**
265         * Checks if two {@link KeyValues} are equal.
266         * @param self first.
267         * @param kvs second.
268         * @return true if equal.
269         */
270        static boolean equals(KeyValues self, KeyValues kvs) {
271                if (self == kvs)
272                        return true;
273                if (kvs.size() != self.size()) {
274                        return false;
275                }
276                for (int i = self.start(); i > -1; i = self.next(i)) {
277                        var k = self.key(i);
278                        var v = self.valueOrNull(i);
279                        if (!Objects.equals(v, kvs.getValueOrNull(k))) {
280                                return false;
281                        }
282                }
283                return true;
284        }
285
286}
287
288final class EmptyKeyValues implements KeyValues {
289
290        static final EmptyKeyValues INSTANCE = new EmptyKeyValues();
291
292        private EmptyKeyValues() {
293        }
294
295        @Override
296        public @Nullable String getValueOrNull(String key) {
297                return null;
298        }
299
300        @Override
301        public void forEach(BiConsumer<? super String, ? super String> action) {
302        }
303
304        @Override
305        public <V> int forEach(KeyValuesConsumer<V> action, int index, V storage) {
306                return index;
307        }
308
309        @Override
310        public int size() {
311                return 0;
312        }
313
314        @Override
315        public int next(int index) {
316                return -1;
317        }
318
319        @Override
320        public String key(int index) {
321                throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(index);
322        }
323
324        @Override
325        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(int index) {
326                throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(index);
327        }
328
329        @Override
330        public int start() {
331                return -1;
332        }
333
334        @Override
335        public Map<String, @Nullable String> copyToMap() {
336                return Map.of();
337        }
338
339        @Override
340        public KeyValues freeze() {
341                return this;
342        }
343
344        @Override
345        public boolean equals(@Nullable Object keyValues) {
346                if (keyValues instanceof KeyValues kvs) {
347                        return kvs.isEmpty();
348                }
349                return false;
350        }
351
352        @Override
353        public int hashCode() {
354                return 1;
355        }
356
357        @Override
358        public String toString() {
359                return "{}";
360        }
361
362}
363
364sealed abstract class AbstractArrayKeyValues implements KeyValues {
365
366        protected static final KeyValuesConsumer<StringBuilder> toStringer = (kvs, k, v, i, b) -> {
367                if (i > 0) {
368                        b.append(',').append(' ');
369                }
370                b.append('"').append(k).append('"').append(':').append('"').append(v).append('"');
371                return i + 1;
372        };
373
374        protected static final int DEFAULT_INITIAL_CAPACITY = 2;
375
376        protected static final String[] EMPTY = new String[] {};
377
378        protected @Nullable String[] kvs;
379
380        protected int size;
381
382        protected int threshold;
383
384        protected AbstractArrayKeyValues(@Nullable String[] kvs, int size, int threshold) {
385                super();
386                this.kvs = kvs;
387                this.size = size;
388                this.threshold = threshold;
389        }
390
391        @Override
392        public String key(int index) {
393                if (index >= (threshold - 1)) {
394                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(index);
395                }
396                String k = kvs[index];
397                if (k == null) {
398                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(index);
399                }
400                return k;
401        }
402
403        @Override
404        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(int index) {
405                if (index >= (threshold - 1)) {
406                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(index);
407                }
408                return kvs[index + 1];
409        }
410
411        @Override
412        public int size() {
413                return this.size;
414        }
415
416        private int _next(int index) {
417                if (size == 0) {
418                        return -1;
419                }
420                var limit = threshold - 1;
421                if (index >= limit) {
422                        return -1;
423                }
424                int i = index;
425                for (; i < limit; i += 2) {
426                        var k = kvs[i];
427                        var v = kvs[i + 1];
428                        if (k == null && v == null) {
429                                continue;
430                        }
431                        return i;
432                }
433                return -1;
434        }
435
436        @Override
437        public int next(int index) {
438                return _next(index + 2);
439        }
440
441        @Override
442        public int start() {
443                return _next(0);
444        }
445
446        @Override
447        public @Nullable String getValueOrNull(String key) {
448                if (size == 0) {
449                        return null;
450                }
451                for (int i = 0; i < (threshold - 1); i += 2) {
452                        var k = kvs[i];
453                        /*
454                         * get
455                         */
456                        if (Objects.equals(k, key)) {
457                                return kvs[i + 1];
458                        }
459                }
460                return null;
461        }
462
463        @Override
464        public void forEach(BiConsumer<? super String, ? super @Nullable String> action) {
465                if (size == 0) {
466                        return;
467                }
468                for (int i = 0; i < (threshold - 1); i += 2) {
469                        var k = kvs[i];
470                        var v = kvs[i + 1];
471                        if (k == null) {
472                                continue;
473                        }
474                        action.accept(k, v);
475                }
476        }
477
478        @Override
479        public <V> int forEach(KeyValuesConsumer<V> action, int index, V storage) {
480                if (size == 0) {
481                        return index;
482                }
483                for (int i = 0; i < (threshold - 1); i += 2) {
484                        var k = kvs[i];
485                        var v = kvs[i + 1];
486                        if (k == null) {
487                                continue;
488                        }
489                        index = action.accept(this, k, v, index, storage);
490                }
491
492                return index;
493
494        }
495
496        @Override
497        public Map<String, @Nullable String> copyToMap() {
498                final Map<String, @Nullable String> result = new HashMap<>(size);
499                forEach(result::put);
500                return result;
501        }
502
503        @Override
504        public String toString() {
505                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
506                KeyValues.prettyPrint(this, sb);
507                return sb.toString();
508        }
509
510        protected static int calculateInitialThreshold(final int initialCapacity) {
511                if (initialCapacity < 0) {
512                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Initial capacity must be at least zero but was " + initialCapacity);
513                }
514                return 2 * ceilingNextPowerOfTwo(initialCapacity == 0 ? 1 : initialCapacity);
515        }
516
517        /**
518         * Calculate the next power of 2, greater than or equal to x.
519         * <p>
520         * From Hacker's Delight, Chapter 3, Harry S. Warren Jr.
521         * @param x Value to round up
522         * @return The next power of 2 from x inclusive
523         */
524        protected static int ceilingNextPowerOfTwo(final int x) {
525                final int BITS_PER_INT = 32;
526                return 1 << (BITS_PER_INT - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(x - 1));
527        }
528
529        @Override
530        public int hashCode() {
531                int result = 1;
532                for (int i = start(); i > -1; i = next(i)) {
533                        var k = key(i);
534                        var v = valueOrNull(i);
535                        result = result + k.hashCode();
536                        result = result + (v == null ? 0 : v.hashCode());
537                }
538                return result;
539        }
540
541        @Override
542        public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
543                if (obj instanceof KeyValues kvs) {
544                        return KeyValues.equals(this, kvs);
545                }
546                return false;
547        }
548
549}
550
551final class ImmutableArrayKeyValues extends AbstractArrayKeyValues {
552
553        @SuppressWarnings("null")
554        ImmutableArrayKeyValues(String[] kvs, int size, int threshold) {
555                super(kvs, size, threshold);
556        }
557
558        @Override
559        public KeyValues freeze() {
560                return this;
561        }
562
563}
564
565/*
566 * A KeyValues that uses a single string array for memory savings which is desirable in
567 * the case of loom where there could be several orders of key values instances at any
568 * given time.
569 */
570final class ArrayKeyValues extends AbstractArrayKeyValues implements MutableKeyValues {
571
572        public ArrayKeyValues() {
573                this(DEFAULT_INITIAL_CAPACITY);
574        }
575
576        @SuppressWarnings("null")
577        public ArrayKeyValues(final int initialCapacity) {
578                this(EMPTY, 0, calculateInitialThreshold(initialCapacity));
579        }
580
581        private ArrayKeyValues(@Nullable String[] kvs, int size, int threshold) {
582                super(kvs, size, threshold);
583                this.kvs = kvs;
584                this.size = size;
585                this.threshold = threshold;
586        }
587
588        @Override
589        public MutableKeyValues copy() {
590                if (size == 0) {
591                        return new ArrayKeyValues();
592                }
593                ArrayKeyValues orig = this;
594                @Nullable
595                String[] copyKvs = new @Nullable String[this.threshold];
596                System.arraycopy(orig.kvs, 0, copyKvs, 0, orig.threshold);
597                return new ArrayKeyValues(copyKvs, size, threshold);
598        }
599
600        @SuppressWarnings("null") // Eclipse bug
601        @Override
602        public KeyValues freeze() {
603                if (size == 0) {
604                        return KeyValues.of();
605                }
606                ArrayKeyValues orig = this;
607                String[] copyKvs = new String[this.threshold];
608                System.arraycopy(orig.kvs, 0, copyKvs, 0, orig.threshold);
609                return new ImmutableArrayKeyValues(copyKvs, size, threshold);
610        }
611
612        public @Nullable String apply(String t) {
613                return getValueOrNull(t);
614        }
615
616        /*
617         * We implement BiConsumer to avoid garbage like entry set and iterators
618         */
619        @Override
620        public void putKeyValue(String key, @Nullable String value) {
621                Objects.requireNonNull(key);
622                if (kvs == EMPTY) {
623                        inflateTable(threshold);
624                }
625
626                for (int i = 0; i < (threshold - 1); i += 2) {
627                        var k = kvs[i];
628                        /*
629                         * replacement
630                         */
631                        if (Objects.equals(k, key)) {
632                                kvs[i + 1] = value;
633                                return;
634                        }
635                        else if (k == null && kvs[i + 1] == null) {
636                                kvs[i] = key;
637                                kvs[i + 1] = value;
638                                size++;
639                                return;
640                        }
641                }
642                ensureCapacity();
643                size++;
644                int valueIndex = (size * 2) - 1;
645                kvs[valueIndex - 1] = key;
646                kvs[valueIndex] = value;
647        }
648
649        @Override
650        public void remove(final String key) {
651                if (kvs == EMPTY) {
652                        return;
653                }
654                for (int i = 0; i < (threshold - 1); i += 2) {
655                        var k = kvs[i];
656                        /*
657                         * remove
658                         */
659                        if (Objects.equals(k, key)) {
660                                kvs[i] = null;
661                                kvs[i + 1] = null;
662                                size--;
663                        }
664                }
665        }
666
667        private void ensureCapacity() {
668                if ((size * 2) >= threshold) {
669                        resize(threshold * 2);
670                }
671        }
672
673        private void resize(final int newCapacity) {
674                final @Nullable String[] oldKvs = kvs;
675
676                kvs = new @Nullable String[newCapacity];
677
678                System.arraycopy(oldKvs, 0, kvs, 0, (size * 2));
679
680                threshold = newCapacity;
681        }
682
683        /**
684         * Inflates the table.
685         */
686        private void inflateTable(final int toSize) {
687                threshold = toSize;
688                kvs = new @Nullable String[toSize];
689        }
690
691}
